title: U.S. and India advance human spaceflight cooperation
summary: The governments of the United States and India announced June 17 they are moving ahead with cooperation on human spaceflight that would include flying an Indian astronaut to the International Space Station, although with few details on who would fly and when.

title: Synspective orders 10 Rocket Lab Electron launches
summary: Japanese radar imaging company Synspective has signed a contract for 10 Electron launches from Rocket Lab, the largest contract in the history of the launch provider.

title: Second Generation Galileo Satellite Designs Pass Critical Milestone
summary: The European Space Agency has announced that the development of both versions of its Galileo Second Generation satellites has reached an important milestone with the successful completion of the Critical Design Reviews. In May 2021, ESA awarded contracts for the second generation of Europe’s Galileo satellite navigation constellation to Thales Alenia Space in Italy and […]

title: SSC Awards  Blue Origin, CACI International, General Atomics, and Viasat Contracts for Laser Communication Terminal Prototypes
summary: SSC Awards  Blue Origin, CACI International, General Atomics, and Viasat Contracts for Laser Communication Terminal Prototypes

title: Redwire Wins DARPA Contract for VLEO Satellite with Novel Propulsion
summary: Redwire Wins DARPA Contract for VLEO Satellite with Novel Propulsion

title: China Conducts Static Fire Test Of Future Moon Rocket Engine
summary: China Conducts Static Fire Test Of Future Moon Rocket Engine

title: Live coverage: SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket to launch SES’s Astra 1P television satellite from Cape Canaveral
summary: The satellite, also known as SES-24, will continue the company’s presence in what SES calls its “prime orbital slot and TV neighborhood” in geostationary Earth orbit. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is set for 5:35 p.m. EDT (2135 UTC).

title: Launch Roundup: Electron launches for the 50th time; Falcon 9 returns to normal operations
summary: Concluding a rare week that was void of any launches and riddled with scrubs, the spaceflight industry looks to return to the planned course of action with four launches from all over the world. This week, the 50th launch of Electron is expected to take flight, and SpaceX and CASC continue to dominate the launch calendar.

title: Spain’s Ienai Space gets funds to demo electrospray thrusters
summary: Spanish small satellite propulsion developer Ienai Space has raised 3.9 million euros ($4.2 million) to start demonstrating electrospray thrusters in low Earth orbit around the end of this year.

title: Space Force taps four firms for laser network project
summary: Blue Origin, CACI International, General Atomics, and Viasat will design optical communications terminals for military spacecraft
